alert.note: Alert for Chickasaw; Clayton; Fayette; Floyd (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 4:37PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Increased Severe Thunderstorm Threat Through Early Evening... At 432 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms both in and heading for northeast Iowa. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, possibly higher. Large Hail and some tornadoes are possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated that thunderstorms were developing and will shift through northeast Iowa. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Tornadoes would cause structural damage. Those in northeast Iowa should be ready to take shelter should wanrings occur. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central and northeastern Iowa...and southwestern Wisconsin.
